required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bladder Drainage During Labor: A Randomized Controlled Study of Obstetric Foley Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Obstetric Foley Therapy (SOFT Trial)

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to compare two clinically-relevant bladder drainage techniques. This is a randomized controlled trial with a single primary outcome of time to delivery. The results will inform clinical decisions about method of catheterization during labor.

detailed_description.textblock:
Urinary catheterization is a common practice during labor following placement of an epidural for pain control, as this form of anesthesia is known to inhibit normal bladder emptying. There is insufficient evidence to guide clinicians in selection of an indwelling catheter versus intermittent straight catheterization during the course of labor.
The goal of this randomized control trial is to compare two clinically-relevant bladder drainage techniques.

primary_outcome.description: Time to delivery defined as IV placement to delivery of infant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in Cost Between the Two Interventions
secondary_outcome.description: Cost of the intermittent vs. foley catheterization procedures was measured and reported in mean dollars.

arm_group.description: Insertion of an indwelling foley catheter when bladder emptying is necessary. The indwelling catheter will remain in place until the time of delivery.
Intermittent straight catheterization will be performed as needed during labor.

intervention.description: Indwelling bladder catheter will remain in place until time of delivery.
intermittent straight catheterization will be performed on an as needed basis until time of delivery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women who present to either Loyola University Medical Center or Loyola at Gottlieb Hospital in active labor or for induction of labor with a singleton pregnancy and who are anticipated to undergo vaginal delivery during the current admission
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who are undergoing a scheduled cesarean delivery
- Women with a contraindication to either of the 2 study interventions
- Multi-fetal gestations
- Current or planned tocolysis
- Women who are on magnesium prophylaxis

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled 7/09-11/09 from the obstetric units of the Loyola University Health System hospitals. Subjects included adult women with a singleton pregnancy who presented to the Labor & Deliver in active labor or for induction, were anticipated to have an normal spontaneous vaginal delivery (NSVD), and had an epidural.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Every patient was assigned to a group immediately following enrollment.

group.title: Indwelling Foley Catheter
group.description: Insertion of an indwelling foley catheter when bladder emptying is necessary. The indwelling catheter will remain in place until the time of delivery.

group.title: Intermittent Straight Catheterization
group.description: Intermittent straight catheterization will be performed as needed during labor.

group.title: Indwelling Foley Catheter
group.description: Insertion of an indwelling foley catheter when bladder emptying is necessary. The indwelling catheter will remain in place until the time of delivery.

group.title: Intermittent Straight Catheterization
group.description: Intermittent straight catheterization will be performed as needed during labor.

outcome.title: Time to Delivery (by Any Route)
outcome.description: Time to delivery defined as IV placement to delivery of infant.
outcome.population: Our a priori sample size required 138 women (69 per group) for 80% power to detect the clinically relevant 30 minute difference in the time to delivery interval with a .05 alpha error.

group.title: Indwelling Foley Catheter
group.description: Insertion of an indwelling foley catheter when bladder emptying is necessary. The indwelling catheter will remain in place until the time of delivery.

group.title: Intermittent Straight Catheterization
group.description: Intermittent straight catheterization will be performed as needed during labor.

measure.title: Time to Delivery (by Any Route)
measure.description: Time to delivery defined as IV placement to delivery of infant.
measure.population: Our a priori sample size required 138 women (69 per group) for 80% power to detect the clinically relevant 30 minute difference in the time to delivery interval with a .05 alpha error.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis is that patients for whom indwelling foley catheterization was employed will have their time to delivery interval reduced by 30 minutes.

outcome.title: Difference in Cost Between the Two Interventions
outcome.description: Cost of the intermittent vs. foley catheterization procedures was measured and reported in mean dollars.
outcome.population: No formal statistical testing was conducted on these measures as complete financial records were not available for the analysis.

group.title: Indwelling Foley Catheter
group.description: Insertion of an indwelling foley catheter when bladder emptying is necessary. The indwelling catheter will remain in place until the time of delivery. Indwelling catheter: Indwelling bladder catheter will remain in place until time of delivery.

group.title: Intermittent Straight Catheterization
group.description: Intermittent straight catheterization will be performed as needed during labor. Intermittent straight catheterization: intermittent straight catheterization will be performed on an as needed basis until time of delivery.

measure.title: Difference in Cost Between the Two Interventions
measure.description: Cost of the intermittent vs. foley catheterization procedures was measured and reported in mean dollars.
measure.population: No formal statistical testing was conducted on these measures as complete financial records were not available for the analysis.

group.title: Indwelling Foley Catheter
group.description: Insertion of an indwelling foley catheter when bladder emptying is necessary. The indwelling catheter will remain in place until the time of delivery.

group.title: Intermittent Straight Catheterization
group.description: Intermittent straight catheterization will be performed as needed during labor.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The are not limitations or caveats to disclose.
